3247@app.route('/api/test_info') 

3248def api_test_info(): 

3249 """Get test status and results.""" 

3250 result = { 

3251 'csv_files': [], 

3252 'test_running': False, 

3253 'test_type': None, 

3254 'current_test': None, 

3255 'passed_tests': [], 

3256 'failed_tests': [], 

3257 'test_list': [], 

3258 'log_file': None, 

3259 'test_results': None, 

3260 'start_time': None 

3261 } 

3262 

3263 # Check for CSV result files first (completed tests) 

3264 csv_pattern = '/opt/fboss/hwtest_results_*.csv' 

3265 try: 

3266 proc = subprocess.run( 

3267 ['bash', '-c', f'ls {csv_pattern} 2>/dev/null || true'], 

3268 capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5 

3269 ) 

3270 if proc.returncode == 0 and proc.stdout.strip(): 

3271 result['csv_files'] = proc.stdout.strip().split('\n') 

3272 except (subprocess.SubprocessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, OSError): 

3273 pass # CSV file listing failed, continue without it 

3274 

3275 # If CSV files exist, parse the latest one 

3276 if result['csv_files']: 

3277 latest_csv = sorted(result['csv_files'])[-1] 

3278 try: 

3279 with open(latest_csv, 'r') as f: 

3280 lines = f.readlines() 

3281 if len(lines) > 1: 

3282 result['test_results'] = { 

3283 'file': latest_csv, 

3284 'total': len(lines) - 1, 

3285 'passed': sum(1 for line in lines[1:] if ',OK' in line or ',PASS' in line), 

3286 'failed': sum(1 for line in lines[1:] if ',FAIL' in line or ',ERROR' in line), 

3287 'tests': [] 

3288 } 

3289 for line in lines[1:]: 

3290 parts = line.strip().split(',') 

3291 if len(parts) >= 2: 

3292 result['test_results']['tests'].append({ 

3293 'name': parts[0], 

3294 'result': parts[1] 

3295 }) 

3296 except Exception as e: 

3297 print(f'Error reading CSV: {e}', flush=True) 

3298 

3299 # Check TEST_STATUS for timestamp to find the actual archive file 

3300 test_status_file = '/opt/fboss/TEST_STATUS' 

3301 if os.path.exists(test_status_file): 

3302 try: 

3303 with open(test_status_file, 'r') as f: 

3304 status_content = f.read() 

3305 # Extract start time to use as search key 

3306 start_match = re.search(r'(?:Sart|Start) Time:(.+?)(?:\n|$)', status_content) 

3307 if start_match: 

3308 timestamp = start_match.group(1).strip() 

3309 print(f'[test_info] Looking for archive with timestamp: {timestamp}', flush=True) 

3310 

3311 # Get platform for test_report directory 

3312 platform = get_platform_name() 

3313 

3314 # Search for archive files with this timestamp in multiple locations 

3315 import glob 

3316 search_patterns = [ 

3317 f'/opt/fboss/*{timestamp}*.tar.gz', 

3318 f'/opt/fboss/*{timestamp}*.log.tar.gz', 

3319 ] 

3320 

3321 # Add test_report directory if platform detected 

3322 if platform: 

3323 test_report_dir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'test_report', platform) 

3324 search_patterns.extend([ 

3325 f'{test_report_dir}/*{timestamp}*.tar.gz', 

3326 f'{test_report_dir}/*{timestamp}*.log.tar.gz', 

3327 ]) 

3328 

3329 archive_files = [] 

3330 for pattern in search_patterns: 

3331 matches = glob.glob(pattern) 

3332 archive_files.extend(matches) 

3333 

3334 # Prefer files ending with .tar.gz (not .log.tar.gz) 

3335 tar_gz_files = [f for f in archive_files if f.endswith('.tar.gz') and not f.endswith('.log.tar.gz')] 

3336 log_tar_gz_files = [f for f in archive_files if f.endswith('.log.tar.gz')] 

3337 

3338 if tar_gz_files: 

3339 result['archive_file'] = tar_gz_files[0] 

3340 print(f'[test_info] Found archive file: {tar_gz_files[0]}', flush=True) 

3341 elif log_tar_gz_files: 

3342 result['archive_file'] = log_tar_gz_files[0] 

3343 print(f'[test_info] Found log archive file: {log_tar_gz_files[0]}', flush=True) 

3344 

3345 # Additionally check for log.tar.gz files specifically 

3346 if log_tar_gz_files: 

3347 result['log_tar_gz'] = os.path.basename(log_tar_gz_files[0]) 

3348 result['log_tar_gz_size'] = os.path.getsize(log_tar_gz_files[0]) 

3349 result['log_tar_gz_time'] = os.path.getmtime(log_tar_gz_files[0]) 

3350 print(f'[test_info] Found log.tar.gz: {result["log_tar_gz"]}', flush=True) 

3351 except Exception as e: 

3352 print(f'[test_info] Error finding archive: {e}', flush=True) 

3353 

3354 # Fallback: If no log.tar.gz found via TEST_STATUS, search directly in /opt/fboss/ 

3355 if 'log_tar_gz' not in result: 

3356 try: 

3357 import glob 

3358 log_tar_pattern = '/opt/fboss/*_BASIC.log.tar.gz' 

3359 log_tar_files = sorted(glob.glob(log_tar_pattern), key=os.path.getmtime, reverse=True) 

3360 if log_tar_files: 

3361 result['log_tar_gz'] = os.path.basename(log_tar_files[0]) 

3362 result['log_tar_gz_size'] = os.path.getsize(log_tar_files[0]) 

3363 result['log_tar_gz_time'] = os.path.getmtime(log_tar_files[0]) 

3364 print(f'[test_info] Found log.tar.gz via fallback search: {result["log_tar_gz"]}', flush=True) 

3365 except Exception as e: 

3366 print(f'[test_info] Error in fallback log.tar.gz search: {e}', flush=True) 

3367 

3368 return jsonify(result) 

3369 

3370 # No CSV files, check TEST_STATUS file to determine if test is running 

3371 test_status_file = '/opt/fboss/TEST_STATUS' 

3372 test_status_info = {} 

3373 

3374 if os.path.exists(test_status_file): 

3375 try: 

3376 with open(test_status_file, 'r') as f: 

3377 status_content = f.read() 

3378 # Parse TEST_STATUS file 

3379 # Format: 

3380 # Sart Time:2026-01-03-AM09-10 

3381 # log:ExitEVT_PLATFORM_VERSION_DATE.tar.gz 

3382 # End Time:2026-01-03-AM09-11 

3383 

3384 start_match = re.search(r'(?:Sart|Start) Time:(.+?)(?:\n|$)', status_content) 

3385 log_match = re.search(r'log:(.+?)(?:\n|$)', status_content) 

3386 end_match = re.search(r'(?:End|Finsih) Time:(.+?)(?:\n|$)', status_content) 

3387 

3388 if start_match: 

3389 test_status_info['start_time'] = start_match.group(1).strip() 

3390 if log_match: 

3391 test_status_info['log_archive'] = log_match.group(1).strip() 

3392 if end_match: 

3393 end_time = end_match.group(1).strip() 

3394 # Only set if not empty 

3395 if end_time: 

3396 test_status_info['end_time'] = end_time 

3397 

3398 # Test is running if we have start time but no end time 

3399 if 'start_time' in test_status_info and 'end_time' not in test_status_info: 

3400 result['test_running'] = True 

3401 result['start_time'] = test_status_info['start_time'] 

3402 print(f'[test_info] Test running based on TEST_STATUS (started: {test_status_info["start_time"]})', flush=True) 

3403 elif 'start_time' in test_status_info and 'end_time' in test_status_info: 

3404 result['test_running'] = False 

3405 result['test_completed'] = True 

3406 result['start_time'] = test_status_info['start_time'] 

3407 result['end_time'] = test_status_info['end_time'] 

3408 # Include log archive for download 

3409 if 'log_archive' in test_status_info: 

3410 result['log_archive'] = test_status_info['log_archive'] 

3411 

3412 # Also check for log.tar.gz file in /opt/fboss/ 

3413 try: 

3414 import glob 

3415 log_tar_pattern = '/opt/fboss/*_BASIC.log.tar.gz' 

3416 log_tar_files = sorted(glob.glob(log_tar_pattern), key=os.path.getmtime, reverse=True) 

3417 if log_tar_files: 

3418 result['log_tar_gz'] = os.path.basename(log_tar_files[0]) 

3419 result['log_tar_gz_size'] = os.path.getsize(log_tar_files[0]) 

3420 result['log_tar_gz_time'] = os.path.getmtime(log_tar_files[0]) 

3421 print(f'[test_info] Found log.tar.gz for completed test: {result["log_tar_gz"]}', flush=True) 

3422 except Exception as log_err: 

3423 print(f'[test_info] Error finding log.tar.gz: {log_err}', flush=True) 

3424 

3425 print(f'[test_info] Test completed based on TEST_STATUS', flush=True) 

3426 

3427 except Exception as e: 

3428 print(f'[test_info] Error reading TEST_STATUS: {e}', flush=True) 

3429 

3430 # If we have log info from TEST_STATUS, try to find and parse the log file 

3431 # This applies to both running tests and completed tests 

3432 if 'log_archive' in test_status_info: 

3433 log_archive = test_status_info['log_archive'] 

3434 

3435 # The log in TEST_STATUS is: ExitEVT_PLATFORM_VERSION_DATE.tar.gz 

3436 # The actual log file is: link_test_VERSION_DATE_BASIC.log 

3437 # Extract VERSION and DATE from the archive name 

3438 

3439 # Pattern: ExitEVT_PLATFORM_VERSION_DATE.tar.gz 

3440 # Example: ExitEVT_WEDGE800BACT_fboss_bins_bcm_JC_20251222_15_54_08_b43cb9b8f5_varFBOSSsai_SAI_13_3_0_GA_20251210_tar_gz.tar.zst_2024-10-18-AM02-50.tar.gz 

3441 archive_match = re.match(r'ExitEVT_([^_]+)_(.+)_(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}-[AP]M\d{2}-\d{2})\.tar\.gz$', log_archive) 

3442 

3443 if archive_match: 

3444 platform = archive_match.group(1) 

3445 version = archive_match.group(2) 

3446 date = archive_match.group(3) 

3447 

3448 # Construct the actual log filename 

3449 log_filename = f"link_test_{version}_{date}_BASIC.log" 

3450 

3451 # Check if file exists in /opt/fboss/ 

3452 opt_fboss_log = os.path.join('/opt/fboss', log_filename) 

3453 if os.path.isfile(opt_fboss_log): 

3454 result['log_file'] = opt_fboss_log 

3455 print(f'[test_info] Found log file from TEST_STATUS: {result["log_file"]}', flush=True) 

3456 else: 

3457 print(f'[test_info] Log file not found: {opt_fboss_log}', flush=True) 

3458 

3459 # Try with .tar.gz extension (archived log) 

3460 log_tar = f"{log_filename}.tar.gz" 

3461 opt_fboss_log_tar = os.path.join('/opt/fboss', log_tar) 

3462 if os.path.isfile(opt_fboss_log_tar): 

3463 result['log_file'] = opt_fboss_log_tar 

3464 print(f'[test_info] Found archived log file: {result["log_file"]}', flush=True) 

3465 else: 

3466 print(f'[test_info] Could not parse archive name: {log_archive}', flush=True) 

3467 

3468 # Fallback: Check for running processes if TEST_STATUS doesn't exist or couldn't be parsed 

3469 if not result.get('test_running') and not test_status_info.get('end_time'): 

3470 try: 

3471 # Try to get test list from run_test.py process 

3472 run_test_proc = subprocess.run( 

3473 ['bash', '-c', 'ps auxww | grep run_test.py | grep -v grep'], 

3474 capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5 

3475 ) 

3476 

3477 if run_test_proc.returncode == 0 and run_test_proc.stdout.strip(): 

3478 result['test_running'] = True 

3479 

3480 # Detect test type from run_test.py command 

3481 if 'run_test.py sai' in run_test_proc.stdout and 'run_test.py sai_agent' not in run_test_proc.stdout: 

3482 result['test_type'] = 'sai' 

3483 elif 'run_test.py link' in run_test_proc.stdout: 

3484 result['test_type'] = 'link' 

3485 elif 'run_test.py sai_agent' in run_test_proc.stdout: 

3486 result['test_type'] = 'agent_hw' 

3487 

3488 # Extract test list from --filter parameter 

3489 filter_match = re.search(r'--filter=([^\s]+)', run_test_proc.stdout) 

3490 if filter_match: 

3491 # Split by colon to get individual tests 

3492 test_filter = filter_match.group(1) 

3493 result['test_list'] = test_filter.split(':') 

3494 print(f'[test_info] Found {len(result["test_list"])} tests from run_test.py, type: {result["test_type"]}', flush=True) 

3495 

3496 # Try to get full command line from sai_mono_link_test process 

3497 ps_proc = subprocess.run( 

3498 ['bash', '-c', 'ps auxww | grep sai_mono_link_test-sai_impl | grep -v grep'], 

3499 capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5 

3500 ) 

3501 

3502 if ps_proc.returncode == 0 and ps_proc.stdout.strip(): 

3503 result['test_running'] = True 

3504 

3505 # Extract current test from --gtest_filter parameter 

3506 gtest_match = re.search(r'--gtest_filter=([^\s]+)', ps_proc.stdout) 

3507 if gtest_match: 

3508 result['current_test'] = gtest_match.group(1) 

3509 print(f'[test_info] Found current test from process: {result["current_test"]}', flush=True) 

3510 except Exception as e: 

3511 print(f'[test_info] Error checking processes: {e}', flush=True) 

3512 

3513 # Now handle the case where test is running (either from TEST_STATUS or processes) 

3514 if result.get('test_running') and not result.get('log_file'): 

3515 try: 

3516 # Find the log file being written from tee process 

3517 tee_proc = subprocess.run( 

3518 ['bash', '-c', 'ps auxww | grep tee | grep -v grep'], 

3519 capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5 

3520 ) 

3521 if tee_proc.returncode == 0 and tee_proc.stdout.strip(): 

3522 # Extract log filename from tee command 

3523 match = re.search(r'tee\s+([^\s]+\.log)', tee_proc.stdout) 

3524 if match: 

3525 log_file = match.group(1) 

3526 # If it's just a filename, check in /opt/fboss/ directory 

3527 if not os.path.isabs(log_file): 

3528 opt_fboss_log = os.path.join('/opt/fboss', log_file) 

3529 if os.path.isfile(opt_fboss_log): 

3530 result['log_file'] = opt_fboss_log 

3531 else: 

3532 result['log_file'] = log_file 

3533 else: 

3534 result['log_file'] = log_file 

3535 

3536 print(f'[test_info] Found log file from tee: {result["log_file"]}', flush=True) 

3537 except Exception as e: 

3538 print(f'[test_info] Error finding log file: {e}', flush=True) 

3539 

3540 # Parse log file if found (to get passed/failed tests history) 

3541 # This applies to both running and completed tests 

3542 if result.get('log_file') and os.path.isfile(result['log_file']): 

3543 try: 

3544 with open(result['log_file'], 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: 

3545 # Read entire file to get test sequence from beginning 

3546 log_content = f.read() 

3547 

3548 # Debug: Log what patterns we're looking for 

3549 print(f'[test_info] Parsing log file: {result["log_file"]}', flush=True) 

3550 print(f'[test_info] Log content length: {len(log_content)} chars', flush=True) 

3551 

3552 # Store last 500 chars for debugging 

3553 result['log_tail'] = log_content[-500:] if len(log_content) > 500 else log_content 

3554 

3555 # Extract test list from the formatted test plan at the top of log 

3556 # Pattern: ClassName. followed by indented method names 

3557 # Also handles parameterized tests like "HwRouteNeighborTest/0. # TypeParam..." 

3558 test_list_from_log = [] 

3559 lines = log_content.split('\n') 

3560 current_class = None 

3561 

3562 for line in lines[:2000]: # Check first 2000 lines for test plan 

3563 # Match class name lines like "AgentEnsembleLinkTest." or "HwRouteNeighborTest/0. # TypeParam..." 

3564 # The comment may be on the same line 

3565 class_match = re.match(r'^([A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_/]+)\.\s*(?:#.*)?$', line.strip()) 

3566 if class_match: 

3567 current_class = class_match.group(1) 

3568 continue 

3569 

3570 # Skip pure comment lines 

3571 if line.strip().startswith('#') or (line.strip() and 'TypeParam' in line and not line.strip()[0].isalpha()): 

3572 continue 

3573 

3574 # Match method names (may or may not be indented) 

3575 if current_class: 

3576 # Match method names - can start with uppercase or lowercase 

3577 method_match = re.match(r'^\s*([a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]+)$', line) 

3578 if method_match: 

3579 method_name = method_match.group(1) 

3580 test_list_from_log.append(f"{current_class}.{method_name}") 

3581 # Don't reset current_class - keep reading methods for this class 

3582 elif line.strip() and not line.strip().startswith(('The ', 'Note:', 'Setting ', 'GTEST_')): 

3583 # Non-empty line that's not a test name or special line, end of this class 

3584 current_class = None 

3585 

3586 if test_list_from_log: 

3587 result['test_list'] = test_list_from_log 

3588 print(f'[test_info] Found {len(test_list_from_log)} tests from log test plan', flush=True) 

3589 

3590 # Also extract from [RUN] entries to supplement any missing tests 

3591 # Preserve the original order from test plan, only add missing tests at the end 

3592 run_matches = re.findall(r'\[\s*RUN\s*\]\s+(\S+)', log_content) 

3593 if run_matches: 

3594 if test_list_from_log: 

3595 # Preserve test plan order, add any missing tests from RUN entries 

3596 seen = set(test_list_from_log) 

3597 for test in run_matches: 

3598 if test not in seen: 

3599 test_list_from_log.append(test) 

3600 seen.add(test) 

3601 result['test_list'] = test_list_from_log 

3602 print(f'[test_info] Final test list: {len(test_list_from_log)} tests (preserving log order)', flush=True) 

3603 else: 

3604 # No test plan found, use RUN entries in their order 

3605 seen = set() 

3606 test_list_from_run = [] 

3607 for test in run_matches: 

3608 if test not in seen: 

3609 seen.add(test) 

3610 test_list_from_run.append(test) 

3611 result['test_list'] = test_list_from_run 

3612 print(f'[test_info] Found {len(test_list_from_run)} tests from [RUN] entries', flush=True) 

3613 

3614 # Only try to find current test from log if we didn't get it from process 

3615 if not result.get('current_test'): 

3616 current_test_match = re.findall(r'\[\s*RUN\s*\]\s+(\S+)', log_content) 

3617 if not current_test_match: 

3618 # Try alternative pattern 

3619 current_test_match = re.findall(r'Running.*?test[:\s]+(\S+)', log_content, re.IGNORECASE) 

3620 

3621 print(f'[test_info] Current test matches from log: {current_test_match}', flush=True) 

3622 

3623 if current_test_match: 

3624 result['current_test'] = current_test_match[-1] 

3625 

3626 # Find passed tests - look for [OK] or [PASSED] pattern 

3627 # Pattern: [ OK ] warm_boot.AgentCoppTest/0.testName (123 ms) 

3628 # Exclude header lines like: ########## Coldboot test results... 

3629 # We want to capture: AgentCoppTest/0.testName (without warm_boot/cold_boot prefix) 

3630 passed_lines = [] 

3631 for line in log_content.split('\n'): 

3632 # Skip header lines with ########## 

3633 if line.strip().startswith('#'): 

3634 continue 

3635 # Match actual test results - now includes /0, /1 etc in test names 

3636 match = re.search(r'\[\s*(?:OK|PASSED)\s*\]\s+(?:(?:warm_boot|cold_boot)\.)?([A-Za-z0-9_/]+\.[A-Za-z0-9_]+)\s+\(\d+\s+ms\)', line) 

3637 if match: 

3638 passed_lines.append(match.group(1)) 

3639 

3640 # Remove duplicates while preserving order 

3641 seen = set() 

3642 passed_unique = [] 

3643 for test in passed_lines: 

3644 if test not in seen: 

3645 seen.add(test) 

3646 passed_unique.append(test) 

3647 

3648 print(f'[test_info] Passed test count: {len(passed_unique)}', flush=True) 

3649 result['passed_tests'] = passed_unique 

3650 

3651 # Find failed tests - exclude header lines with ########## 

3652 # Match multiple formats: 

3653 # 1. [ FAILED ] TestName (123 ms) 

3654 # 2. [ FAILED ] TestName, where TypeParam = ... 

3655 # 3. Header lines: ########## ... [ FAILED ] cold_boot.TestName (0 ms) 

3656 failed_lines = [] 

3657 for line in log_content.split('\n'): 

3658 # Match format 1: [ FAILED ] TestName (123 ms) 

3659 match = re.search(r'\[\s*(?:FAILED|FAIL)\s*\]\s+(?:(?:warm_boot|cold_boot)\.)?([A-Za-z0-9_/]+\.[A-Za-z0-9_]+)\s+\(\d+\s+ms\)', line) 

3660 if match: 

3661 failed_lines.append(match.group(1)) 

3662 continue 

3663 

3664 # Match format 2: [ FAILED ] TestName, where TypeParam = ... 

3665 match = re.search(r'\[\s*(?:FAILED|FAIL)\s*\]\s+([A-Za-z0-9_/]+\.[A-Za-z0-9_]+),\s*where\s+TypeParam', line) 

3666 if match: 

3667 failed_lines.append(match.group(1)) 

3668 

3669 if failed_lines: 

3670 # Remove duplicates while preserving order 

3671 seen = set() 

3672 failed_unique = [] 

3673 for test in failed_lines: 

3674 if test not in seen: 

3675 seen.add(test) 

3676 failed_unique.append(test) 

3677 result['failed_tests'] = failed_unique 

3678 print(f'[test_info] Failed test count: {len(failed_unique)}', flush=True) 

3679 

3680 except Exception as e: 

3681 print(f'Error parsing log file: {e}', flush=True) 

3682 

3683 return jsonify(result) 

3684

3686@app.route('/api/test_log_tail') 

3687def api_test_log_tail(): 

3688 """Get the last N lines of the current test log file.""" 

3689 lines = int(request.args.get('lines', 50)) 

3690 

3691 # Find the log file 

3692 log_file = None 

3693 

3694 # First, try to read from TEST_STATUS file 

3695 test_status_file = '/opt/fboss/TEST_STATUS' 

3696 if os.path.exists(test_status_file): 

3697 try: 

3698 with open(test_status_file, 'r') as f: 

3699 status_content = f.read() 

3700 # Look for log: line in TEST_STATUS 

3701 log_match = re.search(r'log:(.+?)(?:\n|$)', status_content) 

3702 if log_match: 

3703 log_filename = log_match.group(1).strip() 

3704 # The log in TEST_STATUS is the .tar.gz, we need the .log file 

3705 # Extract base name without .tar.gz 

3706 if log_filename.endswith('.log.tar.gz'): 

3707 log_filename = log_filename[:-7] # Remove .tar.gz, keep .log 

3708 

3709 # Check if file exists in /opt/fboss/ 

3710 opt_fboss_log = os.path.join('/opt/fboss', log_filename) 

3711 if os.path.isfile(opt_fboss_log): 

3712 log_file = opt_fboss_log 

3713 except Exception as e: 

3714 print(f'[test_log_tail] Error reading TEST_STATUS: {e}', flush=True) 

3715 

3716 # Fallback: Find the log file from tee process 

3717 if not log_file: 

3718 try: 

3719 tee_proc = subprocess.run( 

3720 ['bash', '-c', 'ps aux | grep tee | grep -v grep'], 

3721 capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5 

3722 ) 

3723 if tee_proc.returncode == 0 and tee_proc.stdout.strip(): 

3724 match = re.search(r'tee\s+([^\s]+\.log)', tee_proc.stdout) 

3725 if match: 

3726 log_file = match.group(1) 

3727 if not os.path.isabs(log_file): 

3728 opt_fboss_log = os.path.join('/opt/fboss', log_file) 

3729 if os.path.isfile(opt_fboss_log): 

3730 log_file = opt_fboss_log 

3731 except Exception as e: 

3732 print(f'[test_log_tail] Error finding tee process: {e}', flush=True) 

3733 

3734 if not log_file or not os.path.isfile(log_file): 

3735 return jsonify({'error': 'Log file not found', 'log_file': log_file}) 

3736 

3737 try: 

3738 # Use tail command to get last N lines 

3739 tail_proc = subprocess.run( 

3740 ['tail', '-n', str(lines), log_file], 

3741 capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5 

3742 ) 

3743 if tail_proc.returncode == 0: 

3744 return jsonify({ 

3745 'log_file': log_file, 

3746 'content': tail_proc.stdout, 

3747 'lines': tail_proc.stdout.count('\n') 

3748 }) 

3749 except (subprocess.SubprocessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, OSError): 

3750 pass # Tail command failed, fall back to manual read 

3751 

3752 # Fallback: read manually 

3753 try: 

3754 with open(log_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: 

3755 all_lines = f.readlines() 

3756 last_lines = all_lines[-lines:] if len(all_lines) > lines else all_lines 

3757 return jsonify({ 

3758 'log_file': log_file, 

3759 'content': ''.join(last_lines), 

3760 'lines': len(last_lines) 

3761 }) 

3762 except Exception as e: 

3763 return jsonify({'error': str(e), 'log_file': log_file}) 

3764

3766@app.route('/api/test_reports') 

3767def api_test_reports(): 

3768 """Get list of available test reports for current platform.""" 

3769 try: 

3770 # Get current platform 

3771 platform = get_platform_name() 

3772 if not platform: 

3773 return jsonify({'error': 'Platform not detected'}) 

3774 

3775 # Check test_report directory 

3776 report_dir = os.path.join('/home/NUI/test_report', platform) 

3777 

3778 if not os.path.exists(report_dir): 

3779 return jsonify({'reports': [], 'platform': platform}) 

3780 

3781 # List all .tar.gz files 

3782 reports = [] 

3783 for filename in os.listdir(report_dir): 

3784 if filename.endswith('.tar.gz'): 

3785 filepath = os.path.join(report_dir, filename) 

3786 stat = os.stat(filepath) 

3787 reports.append({ 

3788 'filename': filename, 

3789 'size': stat.st_size, 

3790 'modified': stat.st_mtime, 

3791 'path': filepath 

3792 }) 

3793 

3794 # Sort by modification time, newest first 

3795 reports.sort(key=lambda x: x['modified'], reverse=True) 

3796 

3797 return jsonify({ 

3798 'reports': reports, 

3799 'platform': platform, 

3800 'report_dir': report_dir 

3801 }) 

3802 except Exception as e: 

3803 return jsonify({'error': str(e), 'reports': []})

3806@app.route('/api/download_log/<filename>') 

3807def api_download_log(filename): 

3808 """Download a log.tar.gz file from /opt/fboss/ directory.""" 

3809 try: 

3810 # Validate filename for security 

3811 if '..' in filename or '/' in filename or '\\' in filename: 

3812 return jsonify({'error': 'Invalid filename'}), 400 

3813 

3814 # Ensure file is .log.tar.gz format 

3815 if not filename.endswith('.log.tar.gz'): 

3816 return jsonify({'error': 'Invalid file format. Only .log.tar.gz files are allowed.'}), 400 

3817 

3818 log_dir = '/opt/fboss' 

3819 file_path = os.path.join(log_dir, filename) 

3820 

3821 # Check if file exists 

3822 if not os.path.exists(file_path): 

3823 return jsonify({'error': f'File not found: {filename}'}), 404 

3824 

3825 # Send file 

3826 return send_file( 

3827 file_path, 

3828 as_attachment=True, 

3829 download_name=filename, 

3830 mimetype='application/gzip' 

3831 ) 

3832 except Exception as e: 

3833 print(f'Error downloading log file: {str(e)}', flush=True) 

3834 return jsonify({'error': str(e)}), 500

3837@app.route('/api/download_report/<path:filename>') 

3838def api_download_report(filename): 

3839 """Download a test report file.""" 

3840 try: 

3841 # Get current platform 

3842 platform = get_platform_name() 

3843 if not platform: 

3844 return jsonify({'error': 'Platform not detected'}), 404 

3845 

3846 report_dir = os.path.join('/home/NUI/test_report', platform) 

3847 filepath = os.path.join(report_dir, filename) 

3848 

3849 # Security check: ensure file is in the correct directory 

3850 if not os.path.abspath(filepath).startswith(os.path.abspath(report_dir)): 

3851 return jsonify({'error': 'Invalid file path'}), 403 

3852 

3853 if not os.path.exists(filepath): 

3854 return jsonify({'error': 'File not found'}), 404 

3855 

3856 return send_file(filepath, as_attachment=True, download_name=filename) 

3857 except Exception as e: 

3858 return jsonify({'error': str(e)}), 500

3919@app.route('/api/test/bins') 

3920def api_test_bins(): 

3921 """List all .zst files from /home/""" 

3922 try: 

3923 bin_dir = '/home' 

3924 

3925 if not os.path.exists(bin_dir): 

3926 return jsonify({'error': f'Bin directory not found: {bin_dir}', 'bins': []}) 

3927 

3928 # List all .zst files 

3929 bins = [] 

3930 for filename in os.listdir(bin_dir): 

3931 if filename.endswith('.zst'): 

3932 filepath = os.path.join(bin_dir, filename) 

3933 if os.path.isfile(filepath):

3935 bins.append({ 

3936 'filename': filename, 

3937 'size': stat.st_size, 

3938 'modified': stat.st_mtime 

3939 }) 

3940

3942 bins.sort(key=lambda x: x['modified'], reverse=True) 

3943 

3944 return jsonify({'bins': bins, 'bin_dir': bin_dir}) 

3945 except Exception as e: 

3946 return jsonify({'error': str(e), 'bins': []})

4015@app.route('/api/test/kill-processes', methods=['POST']) 

4016def api_test_kill_processes(): 

4017 """Kill all test-related processes and their child processes""" 

4018 global CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION 

4019 

4020 try: 

4021 killed_processes = [] 

4022 errors = [] 

4023 

4024 # List of process patterns to kill 

4025 process_patterns = [ 

4026 'run_all_test.sh', 

4027 'Agent_HW_TX_test.sh', 

4028 'ExitEVT.sh', 

4029 'Link_T0_test.sh', 

4030 'Prbs_test.sh', 

4031 'SAI_TX_test.sh', 

4032 'sai_mono_link_test', 

4033 'fboss2', 

4034 'wedge_agent' 

4035 ] 

4036 

4037 print(f'[STOP TEST] Attempting to kill test processes and their children...', flush=True) 

4038 

4039 # Method 1: Find parent PIDs and kill entire process tree 

4040 for pattern in process_patterns: 

4041 try: 

4042 # Find processes matching pattern 

4043 result = subprocess.run( 

4044 ['bash', '-c', f'pgrep -f "{pattern}"'], 

4045 capture_output=True, 

4046 text=True, 

4047 timeout=5 

4048 ) 

4049 

4050 if result.returncode == 0 and result.stdout.strip(): 

4051 pids = result.stdout.strip().split('\n') 

4052 print(f'[STOP TEST] Found {len(pids)} processes for pattern "{pattern}"', flush=True) 

4053 

4054 for pid in pids: 

4055 try: 

4056 # First, find all child processes 

4057 children_result = subprocess.run( 

4058 ['bash', '-c', f'pgrep -P {pid}'], 

4059 capture_output=True, 

4060 text=True, 

4061 timeout=3 

4062 ) 

4063 

4064 # Kill children first 

4065 if children_result.returncode == 0 and children_result.stdout.strip(): 

4066 child_pids = children_result.stdout.strip().split('\n') 

4067 print(f'[STOP TEST] Found {len(child_pids)} child processes for PID {pid}', flush=True) 

4068 for child_pid in child_pids: 

4069 try: 

4070 subprocess.run(['kill', '-9', child_pid], timeout=2, check=True) 

4071 killed_processes.append(f'{pattern} child (PID: {child_pid})') 

4072 print(f'[STOP TEST] Killed child process (PID: {child_pid})', flush=True) 

4073 except Exception as e: 

4074 print(f'[STOP TEST] Failed to kill child {child_pid}: {e}', flush=True) 

4075 

4076 # Then kill parent process 

4077 subprocess.run(['kill', '-9', pid], timeout=2, check=True) 

4078 killed_processes.append(f'{pattern} (PID: {pid})') 

4079 print(f'[STOP TEST] Killed {pattern} (PID: {pid})', flush=True) 

4080 except Exception as e: 

4081 error_msg = f'Failed to kill {pattern} (PID: {pid}): {e}' 

4082 errors.append(error_msg) 

4083 print(f'[STOP TEST] {error_msg}', flush=True) 

4084 except Exception as e: 

4085 print(f'[STOP TEST] Error searching for {pattern}: {e}', flush=True) 

4086 

4087 # Method 2: Use pkill with -9 to kill entire process groups (more aggressive) 

4088 print(f'[STOP TEST] Using pkill as fallback to kill any remaining processes...', flush=True) 

4089 for pattern in process_patterns: 

4090 try: 

4091 # pkill -9 will kill the process and send SIGKILL to children 

4092 result = subprocess.run( 

4093 ['pkill', '-9', '-f', pattern], 

4094 capture_output=True, 

4095 text=True, 

4096 timeout=5 

4097 ) 

4098 if result.returncode == 0: 

4099 print(f'[STOP TEST] pkill succeeded for pattern "{pattern}"', flush=True) 

4100 except Exception as e: 

4101 print(f'[STOP TEST] pkill failed for {pattern}: {e}', flush=True) 

4102 

4103 # Method 3: Use killall as additional fallback 

4104 print(f'[STOP TEST] Using killall as final fallback...', flush=True) 

4105 killall_patterns = ['sai_mono_link_test', 'fboss2', 'wedge_agent'] 

4106 for pattern in killall_patterns: 

4107 try: 

4108 subprocess.run(['killall', '-9', pattern], capture_output=True, timeout=3) 

4109 print(f'[STOP TEST] killall executed for {pattern}', flush=True) 

4110 except (subprocess.SubprocessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, OSError): 

4111 pass # killall failed, process may not exist 

4112 

4113 # Reset global test execution state 

4114 CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION = { 

4115 'running': False, 

4116 'script': None, 

4117 'bin': None, 

4118 'test_level': None, 

4119 'topology': None, 

4120 'topology_file': None, 

4121 'pid': None, 

4122 'start_time': None 

4123 } 

4124 

4125 message = f'Killed {len(killed_processes)} processes' 

4126 if errors: 

4127 message += f' (with {len(errors)} errors)' 

4128 

4129 print(f'[STOP TEST] {message}', flush=True) 

4130 

4131 return jsonify({ 

4132 'success': True, 

4133 'killed': killed_processes, 

4134 'errors': errors, 

4135 'message': message 

4136 }) 

4137 except Exception as e: 

4138 error_msg = f'Exception in kill-processes: {str(e)}' 

4139 print(f'[STOP TEST] {error_msg}', flush=True) 

4140 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': error_msg}), 500 

4141 

4142@app.route('/api/test/start', methods=['POST']) 

4143@limiter.limit(config.RATE_LIMIT_TEST_START) 

4144def api_test_start(): 

4145 """Start test execution with topology apply""" 

4146 from utils.validators import is_safe_filename, sanitize_command_arg, validate_test_items 

4147 

4148 global CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION 

4149 

4150 try: 

4151 data = request.get_json() 

4152 script = data.get('script') 

4153 bin_file = data.get('bin') 

4154 test_level = data.get('test_level') # For SAI_TX_test.sh and Agent_HW_T0_test.sh 

4155 topology = data.get('topology') # For Link_T0_test.sh, ExitEVT.sh, run_all_test.sh (can be comma-separated) 

4156 topology_file = data.get('topology_file') # For run_all_test.sh 

4157 test_items = data.get('test_items') # New: For run_all_test.sh test item selection 

4158 new_bin_uploaded = data.get('new_bin_uploaded', False) 

4159 clean_fboss = data.get('clean_fboss', False) # New option to clean /opt/fboss 

4160 

4161 if not script: 

4162 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Script is required'}), 400 

4163 

4164 # Validate script filename 

4165 if not is_safe_filename(script): 

4166 logger.warning(f"[API] Invalid script filename rejected: {script}") 

4167 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Invalid script filename'}), 400 

4168 

4169 if not bin_file: 

4170 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Bin file is required'}), 400 

4171 

4172 # Validate bin filename 

4173 if not is_safe_filename(bin_file): 

4174 logger.warning(f"[API] Invalid bin filename rejected: {bin_file}") 

4175 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Invalid bin filename'}), 400 

4176 

4177 # Validate test_items if provided 

4178 if test_items and not validate_test_items(test_items): 

4179 logger.warning(f"[API] Invalid test items rejected") 

4180 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Invalid test items'}), 400 

4181 

4182 # Validate topology filename if provided 

4183 if topology_file and not is_safe_filename(topology_file): 

4184 logger.warning(f"[API] Invalid topology filename rejected: {topology_file}") 

4185 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Invalid topology filename'}), 400 

4186 

4187 # Get current platform 

4188 platform = get_cached_platform() or get_platform_name() 

4189 if not platform: 

4190 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Platform not detected'}), 400 

4191 

4192 # Get DUT IP (try to detect from request or use localhost) 

4193 dut_ip = request.host.split(':')[0] if request.host else 'localhost' 

4194 

4195 curl_commands = [] 

4196 

4197 # Note: Topology application is handled by frontend BEFORE calling this endpoint 

4198 # The frontend calls /api/apply_topology first, then calls /api/test/start 

4199 # So we don't need to (and shouldn't) apply topology here - it creates a deadlock 

4200 

4201 # Generate curl command for topology apply if topology_file was provided 

4202 if topology_file and script == 'run_all_test.sh': 

4203 curl_cmd = f'''# Step 1: Apply Topology (already done by frontend) 

4204curl -X POST http://{dut_ip}:5000/api/apply_topology \\ 

4205 -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\ 

4206 -d '{{"platform": "{platform.lower()}", "config_filename": "{topology_file}"}}' 

4207''' 

4208 curl_commands.append(curl_cmd) 

4209 

4210 # Step 2: Kill previous test processes 

4211 try: 

4212 with app.test_client() as client: 

4213 client.post('/api/test/kill-processes') 

4214 except Exception as e: 

4215 print(f'[TEST_START] Warning: Failed to kill previous processes: {e}', flush=True) 

4216 pass # Continue even if process cleanup fails 

4217 

4218 # Step 3: Remove /opt/fboss if user selected clean_fboss option or new bin uploaded 

4219 if clean_fboss or new_bin_uploaded: 

4220 try: 

4221 fboss_dir = '/opt/fboss' 

4222 if os.path.exists(fboss_dir): 

4223 print(f'[TEST_START] Cleaning /opt/fboss directory (clean_fboss={clean_fboss}, new_bin_uploaded={new_bin_uploaded})', flush=True) 

4224 subprocess.run(['rm', '-rf', fboss_dir], timeout=10) 

4225 print(f'[TEST_START] /opt/fboss directory removed successfully', flush=True) 

4226 except Exception as e: 

4227 print(f'Warning: Failed to remove /opt/fboss: {e}', flush=True) 

4228 

4229 # Step 4: Execute test script with appropriate parameters 

4230 script_dir = '/home/NUI/test_script' 

4231 script_path = os.path.join(script_dir, script) 

4232 

4233 if not os.path.exists(script_path): 

4234 return jsonify({ 

4235 'success': False, 

4236 'error': f'Script not found: {script_path}' 

4237 }), 404 

4238 

4239 # Build command based on script type 

4240 if script in ['SAI_TX_test.sh', 'Agent_HW_T0_test.sh']: 

4241 # Usage: ./SAI_TX_test.sh <zst_version> [test_level] 

4242 # Usage: ./Agent_HW_T0_test.sh <zst_version> [test_level] 

4243 if not test_level: 

4244 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': f'Test level (t0 or t1) is required for {script}'}), 400 

4245 cmd = f'cd {script_dir} && ./{script} {bin_file} {test_level}' 

4246 elif script in ['Link_T0_test.sh', 'Link_T1_test.sh', 'ExitEVT.sh']: 

4247 # Usage: ./Link_T0_test.sh <zst_version> <topology_name> [test_cases] 

4248 # Usage: ./Link_T1_test.sh <zst_version> <topology_name> [test_cases] 

4249 # Usage: ./ExitEVT.sh <zst_version> <topology_name> [test_cases] 

4250 if topology: 

4251 cmd = f'cd {script_dir} && ./{script} {bin_file} {topology}' 

4252 else: 

4253 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Topology name is required for this script'}), 400 

4254 elif script == 'run_all_test.sh': 

4255 # Usage: ./run_all_test.sh <zst_version> <topology_name> [test_items] 

4256 if topology: 

4257 # Build test_items string if provided 

4258 test_items_str = '' 

4259 if test_items and isinstance(test_items, dict): 

4260 print(f'[TEST_START] Received test_items: {test_items}', flush=True) 

4261 # Convert test_items dict to comma-separated string 

4262 # Support two formats: 

4263 # Format 1 (array): {sai: ['t0', 't1'], agenthw: ['t0', 't2'], link: true, evt: true} 

4264 # Format 2 (flat): {sai_t0: true, sai_t1: false, agent_t0: true, agent_t1: false, link: true, evt: true} 

4265 selected_items = [] 

4266 

4267 # Check if using flat format (sai_t0, agent_t0, link_t0, etc.) 

4268 # Look for any key that matches flat format pattern 

4269 flat_format_keys = ['sai_t0', 'sai_t1', 'sai_t2', 'agent_t0', 'agent_t1', 'agent_t2', 

4270 'link_t0', 'link', 'evt', 'evt_exit'] 

4271 has_flat_format = any(key in flat_format_keys for key in test_items.keys()) 

4272 

4273 print(f'[TEST_START] Using flat format: {has_flat_format}', flush=True) 

4274 

4275 if has_flat_format: 

4276 # Process flat format 

4277 # SAI tests: sai_t0, sai_t1, sai_t2 

4278 for level in ['t0', 't1', 't2']: 

4279 if test_items.get(f'sai_{level}'): 

4280 selected_items.append(f'SAI_{level.upper()}') 

4281 

4282 # Agent HW tests: agent_t0, agent_t1, agent_t2 

4283 for level in ['t0', 't1', 't2']: 

4284 if test_items.get(f'agent_{level}'): 

4285 selected_items.append(f'AGENT_{level.upper()}') 

4286 

4287 # Link tests: link_t0, link_t1, link_t2 (accept both 'link' and individual levels) 

4288 if test_items.get('link') or test_items.get('link_test'): 

4289 # If parent checkbox is checked, check individual levels 

4290 for level in ['t0', 't1', 't2']: 

4291 if test_items.get(f'link_{level}'): 

4292 selected_items.append(f'LINK_{level.upper()}') 

4293 else: 

4294 # Check individual link levels even if parent not checked 

4295 for level in ['t0', 't1', 't2']: 

4296 if test_items.get(f'link_{level}'): 

4297 selected_items.append(f'LINK_{level.upper()}') 

4298 

4299 # EVT Exit test 

4300 if test_items.get('evt') or test_items.get('evt_exit'): 

4301 selected_items.append('EVT_EXIT') 

4302 else: 

4303 # Process array format (original) 

4304 # Process SAI test levels 

4305 if 'sai' in test_items and isinstance(test_items['sai'], list): 

4306 for level in test_items['sai']: 

4307 selected_items.append(f'SAI_{level.upper()}') 

4308 

4309 # Process Agent HW test levels 

4310 if 'agenthw' in test_items and isinstance(test_items['agenthw'], list): 

4311 for level in test_items['agenthw']: 

4312 selected_items.append(f'AGENT_{level.upper()}') 

4313 

4314 # Process Link test 

4315 if 'link' in test_items and test_items['link']: 

4316 selected_items.append('LINK_T0') 

4317 

4318 # Process EVT Exit test (accept both 'evt' and 'evt_exit') 

4319 if ('evt' in test_items and test_items['evt']) or ('evt_exit' in test_items and test_items['evt_exit']): 

4320 selected_items.append('EVT_EXIT') 

4321 

4322 if selected_items: 

4323 test_items_str = ','.join(selected_items) 

4324 print(f'[TEST_START] Generated test_items_str: "{test_items_str}"', flush=True) 

4325 print(f'[TEST_START] Selected items: {selected_items}', flush=True) 

4326 else: 

4327 print(f'[TEST_START] WARNING: No test items selected! test_items was: {test_items}', flush=True) 

4328 else: 

4329 print(f'[TEST_START] No test_items provided or invalid format. Running all default tests.', flush=True) 

4330 

4331 if test_items_str: 

4332 cmd = f"cd {script_dir} && ./{script} {bin_file} {topology} '{test_items_str}'" 

4333 print(f'[TEST_START] Command: {cmd}', flush=True) 

4334 else: 

4335 cmd = f'cd {script_dir} && ./{script} {bin_file} {topology}' 

4336 print(f'[TEST_START] Command (no test items): {cmd}', flush=True) 

4337 else: 

4338 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': 'Topology type is required for this script'}), 400 

4339 elif script == 'Prbs_test.sh': 

4340 # Usage: ./Prbs_test.sh <zst_version> 

4341 cmd = f'cd {script_dir} && ./{script} {bin_file}' 

4342 else: 

4343 # Default: script + bin 

4344 cmd = f'cd {script_dir} && ./{script} {bin_file}' 

4345 

4346 # Start test in background 

4347 try: 

4348 print(f'[TEST_START] ============================================', flush=True) 

4349 print(f'[TEST_START] About to execute command: {cmd}', flush=True) 

4350 print(f'[TEST_START] Working directory: {script_dir}', flush=True) 

4351 print(f'[TEST_START] Script path exists: {os.path.exists(script_path)}', flush=True) 

4352 print(f'[TEST_START] ============================================', flush=True) 

4353 

4354 # Don't redirect stdout/stderr to allow test script to write logs normally 

4355 # The test scripts use 'tee' to write to log files, which won't work if we capture output 

4356 process = subprocess.Popen( 

4357 ['bash', '-c', cmd], 

4358 cwd=script_dir, 

4359 start_new_session=True # Detach from parent process 

4360 ) 

4361 

4362 print(f'[TEST_START] Process started successfully with PID: {process.pid}', flush=True) 

4363 print(f'[TEST_START] Checking if process is running...', flush=True) 

4364 

4365 # Wait a moment and check if process is still running 

4366 time.sleep(0.5) 

4367 poll_result = process.poll() 

4368 if poll_result is not None: 

4369 print(f'[TEST_START] WARNING: Process exited immediately with code {poll_result}', flush=True) 

4370 else: 

4371 print(f'[TEST_START] Process confirmed running (PID {process.pid})', flush=True) 

4372 

4373 # Update global test execution state 

4374 CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION = { 

4375 'running': True, 

4376 'script': script, 

4377 'bin': bin_file, 

4378 'test_level': test_level, 

4379 'topology': topology, 

4380 'topology_file': topology_file, 

4381 'pid': process.pid, 

4382 'start_time': datetime.now().isoformat() 

4383 } 

4384 

4385 # Generate curl command for test start 

4386 request_data_str = f'{{"script": "{script}", "bin": "{bin_file}"' 

4387 if test_level: 

4388 request_data_str += f', "test_level": "{test_level}"' 

4389 if topology: 

4390 request_data_str += f', "topology": "{topology}"' 

4391 if topology_file: 

4392 request_data_str += f', "topology_file": "{topology_file}"' 

4393 if test_items: 

4394 import json 

4395 request_data_str += f', "test_items": {json.dumps(test_items)}' 

4396 request_data_str += f', "new_bin_uploaded": {str(new_bin_uploaded).lower()}}}' 

4397 

4398 curl_cmd = f'''# Step 2: Start Test 

4399curl -X POST http://{dut_ip}:5000/api/test/start \\ 

4400 -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\ 

4401 -d '{request_data_str}' 

4402''' 

4403 curl_commands.append(curl_cmd) 

4404 

4405 return jsonify({ 

4406 'success': True, 

4407 'message': f'Test started: {script} with {bin_file}', 

4408 'pid': process.pid, 

4409 'curl_commands': curl_commands, 

4410 'curl_text': '\n'.join(curl_commands) 

4411 }) 

4412 

4413 except Exception as e: 

4414 return jsonify({ 

4415 'success': False, 

4416 'error': f'Failed to start test: {str(e)}' 

4417 }), 500 

4418 

4419 except Exception as e: 

4420 return jsonify({'success': False, 'error': str(e)}), 500

4423@app.route('/api/test/status') 

4424def api_test_status(): 

4425 """Check if any test is currently running""" 

4426 global CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION 

4427 

4428 try: 

4429 # Check if we have a tracked test 

4430 if CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['running'] and CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['pid']: 

4431 # Verify process is still running 

4432 try: 

4433 # Check if process exists 

4434 result = subprocess.run( 

4435 ['ps', '-p', str(CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['pid'])], 

4436 capture_output=True, 

4437 timeout=2 

4438 ) 

4439 

4440 if result.returncode == 0: 

4441 # Process is still running 

4442 return jsonify({ 

4443 'running': True, 

4444 'script': CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['script'], 

4445 'bin': CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['bin'], 

4446 'topology': CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['topology'], 

4447 'pid': CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['pid'], 

4448 'start_time': CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['start_time'] 

4449 }) 

4450 else: 

4451 # Process has finished 

4452 CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['running'] = False 

4453 except (ProcessLookupError, OSError): 

4454 CURRENT_TEST_EXECUTION['running'] = False # Process no longer exists 

4455 

4456 # Fallback: Check for any test-related processes 

4457 test_processes = [ 

4458 'run_all_test.sh', 

4459 'Agent_HW_TX_test.sh', 

4460 'ExitEVT.sh', 

4461 'Link_T0_test.sh', 

4462 'Prbs_test.sh', 

4463 'SAI_TX_test.sh' 

4464 ] 

4465 

4466 for process_name in test_processes: 

4467 try: 

4468 result = subprocess.run( 

4469 ['pgrep', '-f', process_name], 

4470 capture_output=True, 

4471 text=True, 

4472 timeout=2 

4473 ) 

4474 

4475 if result.returncode == 0 and result.stdout.strip(): 

4476 return jsonify({ 

4477 'running': True, 

4478 'script': process_name, 

4479 'pid': int(result.stdout.strip().split('\n')[0]) 

4480 }) 

4481 except (subprocess.SubprocessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, ValueError, IndexError): 

4482 pass # Process check failed, try next process 

4483 

4484 return jsonify({'running': False}) 

4485 

4486 except Exception as e: 

4487 return jsonify({'running': False, 'error': str(e)})

4537 except:

4540 if isinstance(config, dict) and 'config' in config and 'name' in config: 

4541 # It's a nested structure, unwrap it

4546 except: 

4547 pass

4560@app.route('/api/test/procedures', methods=['POST']) 

4561def api_test_procedure_save(): 

4562 """Save a test procedure""" 

4563 try: 

4564 data = request.get_json() 

4565 name = data.get('name') 

4566 config = data.get('config') 

4567 

4568 if not name: 

4569 return jsonify({'error': 'Procedure name is required'}), 400 

4570 

4571 if not config: 

4572 return jsonify({'error': 'Configuration is required'}), 400 

4573 

4574 # Sanitize filename 

4575 safe_name = "".join(c for c in name if c.isalnum() or c in (' ', '-', '_')).rstrip() 

4576 safe_name = safe_name.replace(' ', '_') 

4577 

4578 filename = f"{safe_name}.json" 

4579 filepath = os.path.join(TEST_PROCEDURES_DIR, filename) 

4580 

4581 # Fix: Ensure we are saving only the inner config if it was wrapped 

4582 if isinstance(config, dict) and 'config' in config and 'name' in config: 

4583 print(f'[Procedure Save] Detected nested config, unwrapping...', flush=True) 

4584 config = config['config'] 

4585 

4586 # Save procedure 

4587 with open(filepath, 'w') as f: 

4588 json.dump(config, f, indent=2) 

4589 

4590 return jsonify({ 

4591 'success': True, 

4592 'message': f'Test procedure "{name}" saved successfully', 

4593 'filename': safe_name 

4594 }) 

4595 except Exception as e: 

4596 return jsonify({'error': str(e)}), 500

4622@app.route('/api/dut/testing/status', methods=['GET']) 

4623def api_dut_testing_status(): 

4624 """DUT Local API: Check if this DUT is currently running tests. 

4625  

4626 This API runs on the DUT itself and checks local processes. 

4627 Monitor will call this API to determine if DUT is testing. 

4628  

4629 Response: 

4630 { 

4631 "testing": true, 

4632 "processes": ["/opt/fboss/bin/wedge_agent", "/opt/fboss/bin/hw_test"], 

4633 "process_count": 2, 

4634 "timestamp": "2026-01-22T10:30:00" 

4635 } 

4636 """ 

4637 try: 

4638 processes = [] 

4639 is_testing = False 

4640 

4641 # Check for test scripts 

4642 test_scripts = [ 

4643 'run_all_test.sh', 

4644 'Agent_HW_TX_test.sh', 

4645 'ExitEVT.sh', 

4646 'Link_T0_test.sh', 

4647 'Link_T1_test.sh', 

4648 'Prbs_test.sh', 

4649 'SAI_TX_test.sh' 

4650 ] 

4651 

4652 for script in test_scripts: 

4653 result = subprocess.run( 

4654 ['pgrep', '-f', script], 

4655 capture_output=True, 

4656 text=True, 

4657 timeout=2 

4658 ) 

4659 

4660 if result.returncode == 0 and result.stdout.strip(): 

4661 is_testing = True 

4662 processes.append(script) 

4663 

4664 # Also check for any process from /opt/fboss/bin/ directory 

4665 result = subprocess.run( 

4666 "ps aux | grep /opt/fboss/bin/ | grep -v grep", 

4667 shell=True, 

4668 capture_output=True, 

4669 text=True, 

4670 timeout=5 

4671 ) 

4672 

4673 if result.returncode == 0 and result.stdout.strip() != '': 

4674 is_testing = True 

4675 # Extract process names 

4676 for line in result.stdout.strip().split('\n'): 

4677 # Try to extract the executable path from ps output 

4678 parts = line.split() 

4679 for part in parts: 

4680 if '/opt/fboss/bin/' in part: 

4681 if part not in processes: 

4682 processes.append(part) 

4683 break 

4684 

4685 return jsonify({ 

4686 'testing': is_testing, 

4687 'processes': processes, 

4688 'process_count': len(processes), 

4689 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() 

4690 }) 

4691 except Exception as e: 

4692 return jsonify({ 

4693 'testing': False, 

4694 'error': str(e), 

4695 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() 

4696 }), 500

4785 except ValueError: 

4786 # Skip invalid date formats 

4787 pass

4790 reports.sort(key=lambda x: x['date'], reverse=True) 

4791 

4792 return jsonify({

4795 'reports': reports, 

4796 'count': len(reports)

4798 except Exception as e:

4801 'error': str(e), 

4802 'platform': platform

4832 t = threading.Thread( 

4833 target=monitor_services, 

4834 kwargs={'poll_interval': config.MONITOR_INTERVAL}, 

4835 daemon=True 

4836 )

4858

4860 logger.info(f"Starting Flask server on {config.HOST}:{config.PORT}")
